text: Shady Oaks, also known as the Cheek-Twitty House, is a historic plantation house located near Warrenton, Warren County, North Carolina. ==Overview== It was built about 1815, and is a tripartite Federal style frame dwelling. It consists of a rather narrow two-story central block, flanked by perpendicular two-bay wings, with one-story frame additions. It is sheathed in weatherboard, has a gable roof, and one-story shed porch. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1976. == References == Category:Plantation houses in North Carolina Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Federal architecture in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1815 Category:Houses in Warren County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Warren County, North Carolina
title: Shady Oaks
